column3: str

The House Manderville artisan stands ready to facilitate your forging request.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You approach the House Manderville artisan with a request to forge a new Manderville weapon. The accommodating craftsman asks only that you supply him with the necessary chunks of manderium meteorite─an exhausting and expensive process with which you are already intimately familiar.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

No sooner have you delivered the meteorite chunks into the artisan's hands than he and Gerolt collaborate in the creation of another masterful Manderville armament. Should you wish to expand your armory of Manderville weaponry, it seems you have only to ask...assuming you've brought a sufficient number of exorbitantly priced sky rocks, of course.
Deliver the chunks of manderium meteorite to the House Manderville artisan.

Please note that upon completing the quest “Make Another Manderville,” you will receive a Manderville weapon for <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>.
Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with the House Manderville artisan.
What will you do?
Undertake this quest as another job.

Undertake this quest as <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),10))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),14))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),5))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),26))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),33))>an <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/><Else/>a <Sheet(ClassJob,PlayerParameter(68),0)/></If></If></If></If></If>.
Please speak with the House Manderville artisan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

You have already received <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/> and <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(2),1,1)/>. Please change to a different job and speak with the House Manderville artisan again.
You have already received <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>. Please change to a different job and speak with the House Manderville artisan again.

Greetings and salutations, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! I stand willing and able to aid you in the creation of any Manderville weaponry you may desire.
Before we can fulfill your request, however, I must ask that you provide me with the necessary quantity of manderium meteorite. Three solid chunks of the stuff, to be precise.
Chunks of manderium meteorite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

How fare your efforts to acquire the manderium meteorite? ...Ah, still a work in progress, I see. Not to worry! I shall endure the tedium of waiting by imagining all the ways I might spend my substantial retainer's fee.
Chunks of manderium meteorite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.
You have something for me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>?

Ah, yes, the meteorite chunks! I certainly wasn't expecting a Hannish curry and a bottle of chilled lassi, no indeed... Ahem, the extraction process should take but a moment, so I shall call upon Master Gerolt to have his anvil ready.
Another masterpiece!
Yer now the proud owner o' <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/> an' <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(2),1,1)/>!
Yer now the proud owner o' <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>!
Bravo! You are truly an inspiration, Master Gerolt! Never could I have achieved such perfection alone, and certainly not within the constraints of excess clothing!
All in a day's work fer this ol' dog, hah!
I trust you are satisfied with the results of our work? Should you ever wish to expand your armory of Manderville weaponry, I am at your service for the foreseeable future.
